name: Ynes Mexia
quote: I am going to collect plants until I die.
summary: Mexican-American botanist who collected over 150,000 plant specimens and discovered hundreds of new species across the Americas.
shortDescription: Ynes Mexia was a Mexican-American botanist who collected over 150,000 plant specimens and discovered hundreds of new species. She began her botanical career at age 55 and became one of the most prolific plant collectors of her time.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in Washington, D.C., Ynes spent her early years in Mexico. She began her botanical career later in life, starting at age 55.
detailed_description.stem_journey: Ynes joined the University of California, Berkeley and began collecting plants throughout the Americas. She made numerous expeditions to remote areas.
detailed_description.challenges: As a woman in botany and as a Mexican-American, Ynes faced discrimination. She also began her career at an advanced age.
detailed_description.achievements: Collected over 150,000 plant specimens, discovered hundreds of new species, and made expeditions throughout the Americas.
detailed_description.legacy: Ynes's work contributed significantly to botanical knowledge and inspired women in plant biology.

awards: Honorary member of the California Academy of Sciences

timeline.event: Began botanical studies at UC Berkeley

impact: Contributed significantly to botanical knowledge and inspired women in plant biology.
mentorship: Mentored students and advocated for women in botany.
fun_fact: Ynes began her botanical career at age 55.

career_path.advice_for_students: It's never too late to pursue your passion for science.

student_resources.advice: Explore nature and don't let age or background stop you.

challenges.how_overcame: Persevered through determination and passion for plants.

education_details.study_tips: Learn through hands-on experience and exploration.

modern_impact.current_applications: Her specimens are used in botanical research worldwide.
modern_impact.future_implications: Her collections continue to inform plant science.

cultural_background.cultural_contributions: Pioneered Mexican-American women's participation in botany.
